content: dishcloth recipe all kinds of recipes for grandma s dishcloth have been jotted down on paper and passed around for ages years ago i was shown his particular trick of adding a two stitch short row on the two decrease corners in my opinion it aids the gentle turn of those corners making them sharper and helps the dishcloth to remain square this type of recipe pattern has been free since the dawn of time i do not claim this as my own but would like to share the recipe of how i remember it being shown to me you may distribute this one freely and sell the finished items but please do not print and sell the pattern because … grandma would be highly disappointed with you happy knitting xoxo ©2018 robin wiest gather your tools gauge not that important i like my dish clothes at a nice tight gauge not all loosey goosey my preferred needle size size us 6 or 7 check suggested needle size on ball band some cotton suggestions i love this cotton knit picks dishie yarn and sugar n cream stitches used co cast on kfb knit into front and back of stitch yo yarn over k2tog knit next 2 stitches together bobble bind off recipe directions - co 3 sts - knit one row - k1 kfb k1 4sts - start increasing *k2 yo knit to end of row * repeat between ** until you have 46sts on your needles - now the tiny short row *k2 turn work k2 turn k1 k2tog yo k2tog knit across to end of row * repeat between** one more time - now decrease *k1 k2tog yo k2tog knit across to end of row *repeat this until you have 4sts left - k1 k2tog k1 - k1 k2tog bobble pass stitch over whooohooo now go make a million more and wash some dishes
